column1:
4.2.6	
Summary of evidence and recommendations for the management of ureteral trauma

Visually identify the ureters to prevent ureteral trauma during complex abdominal and pelvic 
surgery.

Beware of concomitant ureteral injury in all abdominal penetrating trauma, and in 
deceleration-type blunt trauma.
Use pre-operative prophylactic stents in high-risk cases.
Repair iatrogenic ureteral injuries recognised during surgery immediately.

Treat iatrogenic ureteral injuries with delayed diagnosis by nephrostomy tube/JJ stent 
urinary diversion.

Manage ureteral strictures by ureteral reconstruction according to the location and length of 
the affected segment.
